Backplane provided API

API provided by the backplane to the framework adapters. More...

Data Structures

struct  bp_api_struct
 Structure containing function pointers to the backplane provided API. More...

Defines

#define BP_PROVIDED_API_FUNCTION(f)   bp_##f##_type f##_ptr
 Macro for backplane function type define.
#define SET_TRAY_ITEM(i)   m_c_api_tray.i##_ptr = bp_##i
 Macro that sets the function ptr in the C API tray.

Detailed Description

API provided by the backplane to the framework adapters.

typedef int(*) bp_create_child_junction_node_type(int framework_id, const char *target_framework_indicator, const char *component_type_name, const char *instance_name, const char *parent_full_name, int parent_junction_node_id)

typedef for bp_create_child_junction_node() function ptr

Create a child junction node

Parameters:
framework_id - Unique ID of the framework adapter
target_framework_indicator - Target framework's indicator name
component_type_name - Component type name of the child to be created
instance_name - Instance name of the child to be created
parent_full_name - Full hierarchical path name of the calling parent component
parent_junction_node_id - ID of the parent junction node
Returns:
Return status
  • 1 : success
  • 0 : error

Definition at line 188 of file bp_provided.h.

typedef void(*) bp_notify_runtime_phase_type(unsigned int framework_id, const char *phase_group, const char *phase_name, uvm_ml_phase_action phase_action, uvm_ml_time_unit time_unit, double time_value, unsigned int *participate)

typedef for bp_notify_runtime_phase() function ptr

Notifies the execution of a time consuming phase.

Called by the master phase controller to notify a runtime phase. Unlike non-runtime phases which could execute either topdown or bottom-up, a runtime phase is executed 'in parallel'. Therefore, the phase is broadcast to all framework only once, regardless of how many toplevel components the framework contains. The framework should phase all its' toplevel component at the same time. A framework could choose to participate in phase synchronization (controlling when the phase will end) by asserting the participate variable. The framework notifies the phase master that it's ready to exit the phase by calling bp_notify_phase_done(). The master phase controller will wait until all participating frameworks are ready to exit the phase before continuing on to the next phase.

Parameters:
framework_id - Unique ID of the framework adapter
phase_group - Name of the group the phase belongs in (eg. common, uvm ...)
phase_name - Name of the phase
phase_action - The action for this phase (start, execute, ready to end, ended)
time_unit - Current simulation time unit
time_value - Current simulatin time scaled according to time_unit
participate - Indicate the number of frameworks participating in this phase
Returns:
Return status
  • 1 : success
  • 0 : error

Function Documentation

int bp_add_root_node ( unsigned  adapter_id,
unsigned  top_level_id,
const char *  component_name,
const char *  instance_name 
)

Register a root node with backplane.

Allows a framework to add a root node descriptor procedurally (rather than as an argument of bp_run_test() or Bootstrap())

Parameters:
adapter_id - Unique ID of the framework adapter the root node is in
top_level_id - ID of the root node (unique for this framework)
component_name - Type identifier name of the root node
instance_name - Instance name of the root node (to be used in a full hierarchical name)
Returns:
Returns with one of the following codes:
  • 1 : if root node was added
  • 0 : if it was already register before
  • (-1) : error (eg. if another root node was already registered with the same instance name)

)

Part of the pseudo-blocking mechanism for implementation of the.

TLM2 blocking transport interface method. This method shall be invoked by the producer framework's ML adapter after the thread spawned by bp_request_b_transport_tlm2() completes and the provider framework ML adapter notifies the producer via NotifyEndTask()

Definition at line 585 of file bp_provided.cpp.

uvm_ml_type_id_t bp_get_type_id_from_name ( int  framework_id,
const char *  type_name 
)

Returns the type ID of a transaction by it's name.

May be used for transaction runtime type identification Assuming that the connected frameworks support passing polymorphic transactions across the same TLM port/socket, the connected frameworks shall map the corresponding type names and obtain the unique type id from the bp. By default, the corresponding types are matched by name. Once the type id is obtained, it shall be included by the producer/initiator in the transaction meta data and the provider/target shall use the id to construct the correct object.

Parameters:
framework_id - Unique ID of the framework adapter
type_name - Type name of a transaction object
Returns:
Transaction object type ID.

Definition at line 1500 of file bp_provided.cpp.

void bp_notify_runtime_phase ( unsigned int  framework_id,
const char *  phase_group,
const char *  phase_name,
uvm_ml_phase_action  phase_action,
uvm_ml_time_unit  time_unit,
double  time_value,
unsigned int *  participate 
)

Notifies the execution of a runtime phase. A phase that consumes time.

Called by the master phase controller to notify a runtime phase. Unlike non-runtime phases which could execute either topdown or bottom-up, a runtime phase is executed 'in parallel'. Therefore, the phase is broadcast to all framework only once, regardless of how many toplevel components the framework contains. The framework should phase all its' toplevel component at the same time. A framework could choose to participate in phase synchronization (controlling when the phase will end) by asserting the participate variable. The framework notifies the phase master that it's ready to exit the phase by calling bp_notify_phase_done(). The master phase controller will wait until all participating frameworks are ready to exit the phase before continuing on to the next phase.

Parameters:
framework_id - Unique ID of the framework adapter
phase_group - Name of the group the phase belongs in (eg. common, uvm ...)
phase_name - Name of the phase
phase_action - The action for this phase (start, execute, ready to end, ended)
time_unit - Current simulation time unit
time_value - Current simulatin time scaled according to time_unit
participate - Indicate the number of frameworks participating in this phase
Returns:
Return status
  • 1 : success
  • 0 : error

phase_action - The action for this phase (start, execute, ready to end, ended)
Returns:
Return status
  • 1 : success
  • 0 : error

int bp_transport ( int  framework_id,
int  producer_id,
unsigned int  req_stream_size,
uvm_ml_stream_t  req_stream,
unsigned int *  rsp_stream_size,
uvm_ml_stream_t  rsp_stream,
uvm_ml_time_unit *  time_unit,
double *  time_value 
)

TLM1 blocking transport interface method.

This native blocking call is not supported. The pseudo-blocking mechanism of RequestTransport/NotifyEndTask() should be used instead.

Parameters:
framework_id - Unique ID of the framework adapter
producer_id - Connection ID on the producer's framework adapter side
req_stream_size - Size (in words) of the serialized request data stream
req_stream - Serialize request data
rsp_stream_size - Size (in words) of the serialized response data stream
rsp_stream - Serialize response data
time_unit - Current simulation time unit
time_value - Current simulatin time scaled according to time_unit
Returns:
Returns 0 - unsupported.

unsigned int bp_transport_response ( int  framework_id,
int  producer_id,
int  call_id,
uvm_ml_stream_t  rsp_stream 
)

Part of the pseudo-blocking mechanism for implementation of the.

TLM1 blocking transport interface method. This method shall be invoked by the producer framework's ML adapter after the thread spawned by RequestTransport() completes and the provider framework ML adapter notifies the producer via NotifyEndTask()

Parameters:
framework_id - Unique ID of the framework adapter
producer_id - Connection ID on the producer's framework adapter side
call_id - Unique ID, assigned to this call by the producer framework adapter
rsp_stream - Serialize data
Returns:
Output stream size.
